snippet: The Beach Boys’ “That’s Why God Made the Radio,” the reunion album tied to that band’s 50th-anniversary tour, is a reflection on aging and memory, on longing and mortality.
abstract: Jon Pareles reviews That's Why God Made the Radio, the latest album from the Beach Boys; Nate Chinen reviews Alan Jackson record Thirty Miles West; Ben Ratliff reviews album Childhood's End from the Norwegian band Ulver.

byline.original: By JON PARELES, NATE CHINEN and BEN RATLIFF

lead_paragraph: The Beach Boys’ “That’s Why God Made the Radio,” the reunion album tied to that band’s 50th-anniversary tour, is a reflection on aging and memory, on longing and mortality.

headline.seo: New Releases From the Beach Boys and Alan Jackson
headline.main: Another Solstice in an Endless Summer
headline.print_headline: Another Solstice in an Endless Summer
